posts.post_content:
*I don't know how thrilled I am with this card. I mean it's a good card, right? But Im not partial to cards that I have to dispose of after they've been used once.*  
You would be partial to it if you had a burn deck. Attack for 6 on the third turn with trample! Even if they have a couple of 1/1s out to double block, its still going to do 4 damage via trample. Hard to get a better creature for a burn deck.

posts.post_content:
*Creatures are spells. Cancel WOrks.*  
  
i think the previous point is...   
say you knew that your opponent was sporting a aggro red deck, its your third turn, and theres a chance he can cast a ball lightning next turn, u wouldnt play anything? in other words set your game back an entire turn, just so u can maybe counter a ball lightning (that he may or may not have in his hand)?  
  
major complaint though, i think space could be saved by not having reminder text for trample (i think most players figured that one out already), and add some flavor? i think in the entire history of ball lightning, there hasn't been a single flavor.

posts.post_content: Ball lightning is just a great card for any red aggro themed decks. I find it's creature status benefits it quite a bit (as you can't simply [cancel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=cancel) it). However this card isn't without drawbacks. First of all while it's mana cost might be an extremely reasonable (3) it all must be red mana. Where am I getting at? Are you into multicolor decks? You can forget about using ball lightning right on the get go. I'm sure there must be a couple of ways around this however they all require you to be lucky enough to draw the right cards. Another drawback is that, while the creature status might give ball lightning some advantages, it also makes it vulnerable to creature elimination cards (such as [doomblade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=doomblade), sure the name is cliche but the card is brutally effective). This little drawbacks might keep ball lightning from being an unstoppable nightmare, but it is still an excellent source for quick damage. I think all red oriented players should consider ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:

You can forget about using ball lightning right on the get go. I'm sure there must be a couple of ways around this however they all require you to be lucky enough to draw the right cards. Another drawback is that, while the creature status might give ball lightning some advantages, it also makes it vulnerable to creature elimination cards (such as doomblade, sure the name is cliche but the card is brutally effective). This little drawbacks might keep ball lightning from being an unstoppable nightmare, but it is still an excellent source for quick damage. I think all red oriented players should consider ... Posted By: Fredin (7/19/2009 10:47:18 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Fredin, ghostie is right. Also, [Cancel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cancel) is pretty terrible. You should only use it if you can't get a hold of a [Counterspell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Counterspell). I do agree with you though, this card is wonderful - but I do disagree that it needs to be a pure red deck to run it. It really just needs to be primarily red. And there are always things that can tap for both red and another color you decide to run. [Crumbling Necropolis](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Crumbling Necropolis) or [Boros Garrison](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boros Garrison), for example. Also, some non-lands ([Veinfire Borderpost](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Veinfire Borderpost)). Yes, the mana cost tells you that you should be running primarily red - but not **all** red. So yes, please keep these. They're good. =P (Plus, if you rated it a 4/5 in your post - why did you give it a .5/5 on the rating system?)
posts.html:
Fredin, ghostie is right. Also, Cancel is pretty terrible. You should only use it if you can't get a hold of a Counterspell. I do agree with you though, this card is wonderful - but I do disagree that it needs to be a pure red deck to run it. It really just needs to be primarily red. And there are always things that can tap for both red and another color you decide to run. Crumbling Necropolis or Boros Garrison, for example. Also, some non-lands (Veinfire Borderpost). Yes, the mana cost tells you that you should be running primarily red - but not all red. So yes, please keep these. They're good. =P (Plus, if you rated it a 4/5 in your post - why did you give it a .5/5 on the rating system?)
